timeline.bodyText:
AFAICT AbstractInfinispanServerDriver.createUserFile runs with a non-default configuration just as well as with the default configuration, so this check isn't necessary.
In general I would prefer a method like isContainerRunWithDefaultServerConfig() to return true only if running with the default configuration that ships in the server image, not a configuration file that ships in the testdriver jar.
timeline.author: danberindei

replies.bodyText:
it is necessary since I only want to add this configuration for container mode and when the default file is requested (which is secured). Otherwise, users need to concern too early about security. But I don't want to make this in embedded since default config files stuff are not supported yet, and there are XML files that are not secured in our tests. So if I add a user admin, I get hard error because the server is not secured in the test but I try to connect with a user. (check the other runs errors)
I don't know how to make this better for now.
replies.author: karesti

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the explanation Katia, I thought that the users were added for every configuration.
